title: Zoey Deutch and her mother Lea Thompson both stun at LA premiere of Zombieland: Double Tap
text:
The follow-up to the cult classic hit film - Zombieland - is set to hit theaters on October 18, which is 10th anniversary of the original film's release.

And on Thursday, the Los Angeles premiere for Zombieland: Double Tap was held at the Regency Village Theatre.

One of the stars to join the cast for the sequel, Zoey Deutch, got a little family support at the event from her mother, Lea Thompson, who's best known for her roles in the Back To The Future franchise.

Family support: Zoey Deutch and her mother Lea Thompson attended the premiere of Zombieland: Double Tap in Los Angeles on Thursday night

Deutch, 24, oozed classic elegance when she hit the red carpet in a blush-patterned gown.

The eye-catching number's off-she-shoulder and fitted upper design showed off her toned figure.

For an added touch of style, the piece had ruffled fabric along the chest region and diamond-shaped patterns.

She rounded out the ensemble with matching heels and wore her bob-cut tresses just above the shoulders but pushed back behind her ears.

Undeniable: The mother-daughter tandem showed off their chemistry on the red carpet

Stylish: Deutch oozed classic elegance when she hit the red carpet in a blush-patterned gown

Lady in black: Deutch's mother Lea Thompson turned back the clock in a black satin duster jacket that was worn over a black slip dress

Thompson, 58, turned back the clock in a black satin duster jacket that was worn over a black slip dress.

She matched it with black and white patterned open-toe heels and carried a black hand purse.

On this festive night, she wore her wavy light brown tresses long and flowing past her shoulders, but had the hair on the top part of her head pulled back off of her face.

Under the bright lights: Both mother and daughter were all smiles when they shared the spotlight together

Newbie: Deutch plays Madison, a new survivor of the apocalypse, in the sequel

The stars of the original film - Woody Harrelson, Emma Stone, Jesse Eisenberg and Abigail Breslin - are all back for round two of the horror-comedy along with director Ruben Fleischer and writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick.

Some of the other big names to appear in the film include Rosario Dawson, Luke Wilson, Thomas Middleditch and Avan Jogia. Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd are also due to appear as fictionalized versions of themselves. The mayhe,m

In the sequel, the comic mayhem stretches from the White House through the heartland, as the four slayers face off against new kinds of zombies that have evolved since the first movie, as well as some new human survivors. But most of all, the group has to face the growing pains of their own snarky, makeshift family.

The first film was a critical and commercial success, grossing more than $102 million at the worldwide box office on a $23.6 million budget.

Making her mark: The actress began her career with starring roles in Beautiful Creatures (2013) and Vampire Academy (2014)

Hollywood resume: Along with Back To The Future, Thompson also gained fame for roles in All The Right Moves, Red Dawn, Some Kind Of Wonderful and the NBC series Caroline In The City
description: Zoey Deutch oozed elegance in blush-patterned gown alongside her mother Lea Thompson who stunned in all-black ensemble at LA premiere of Zombieland: Double Tap on Thursday.
